Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there are the actual Msols (unknowable precisely) and the implied Msols

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the diff, which is adjusted constantly based on block finding times

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: since diff adjusts based on the blocktimes, if there is a run of good luck, the diff goes up

Author: house#8741
Content: but by law of avg it will eventually balance out ?

Content: yes

Author: jl777c#5810

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: "\nReturns the estimated network solutions per second based on the last n blocks.\n"

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes Msol is just average over last 120 blocks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: diff adjustments over 17 block window, so that is why diff is more volatile

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: which means the diff will appear to lead the Msols

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: like SMA 17 vs SMA.120

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but not exactly as diff has caps per adjustment and isnt a pure MA

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: thanks! I never knew this until now
